bugs.title: CVE-2020-15275 moin: malicious SVG attachment causing stored XSS vulnerability [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-15275 moin: malicious SVG attachment causing stored XSS vulnerability [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-15275 moin: malicious SVG attachment causing stored XSS vulnerability

long_desc.thetext:
MoinMoin is a wiki engine. In MoinMoin before version 1.9.11, an attacker with write permissions can upload an SVG file that contains malicious javascript. This javascript will be executed in a user's browser when the user is viewing that SVG file on the wiki. Users are strongly advised to upgrade to a patched version. MoinMoin Wiki 1.9.11 has the necessary fixes and also contains other important fixes.

Reference:
https://github.com/moinwiki/moin-1.9/security/advisories/GHSA-4q96-6xhq-ff43

Upstream patch:
https://github.com/moinwiki/moin-1.9/commit/31de9139d0aabc171e94032168399b4a0b2a88a2

Created moin tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1897190]
Affects: fedora-31 [bug 1897191]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of epel-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora EPEL. While
only one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions
at the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each
other, you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=high

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1897189,1897190

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

bugs.title: CVE-2020-25074 moin: remote code execution via cache action [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-25074 moin: remote code execution via cache action [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-25074 moin: remote code execution via cache action

long_desc.thetext:
The cache action in action/cache.py in MoinMoin through 1.9.10 allows directory traversal through a crafted HTTP request. An attacker who can upload attachments to the wiki can use this to achieve remote code execution.

Reference:
https://github.com/moinwiki/moin-1.9/security/advisories/GHSA-52q8-877j-gghq

Created moin tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1897193]
Affects: fedora-31 [bug 1897194]

that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of epel-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:

FEDORA-EPEL-2023-6569f44fa5 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2023-6569f44fa5

FEDORA-EPEL-2023-6569f44fa5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 testing repository.

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2023-6569f44fa5

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-EPEL-2023-6569f44fa5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

Description of problem:

Moin upstream released a 1.9.11 version (see https://github.com/moinwiki/moin-1.9/blob/1.9.11/docs/CHANGES#L13)

This is a request to maintainer to bump actual 1.9.10 (available in epel7) to 1.9.11

FWIW, a scratch build works fine and deployed on https://wiki.stg.centos.org and no issue found so far
https://cbs.centos.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=1888664

--- moin.spec.orig	2021-01-26 06:43:52.828025532 +0000
+++ moin.spec	2021-01-26 06:45:56.142455386 +0000
@@ -1,6 +1,6 @@
 Summary: MoinMoin is a WikiEngine to collaborate on easily editable web pages
 Name: moin
-Version: 1.9.10
+Version: 1.9.11
 Release: 1%{?dist}
 License: GPLv2+
 Group: Applications/Internet
@@ -58,6 +58,8 @@
 %{_datadir}/moin/
 
 %changelog
+* Tue Jan 26 2021 Fabian Arrotin <arrfab@centos.org> - 1.9.11-1
+- Update to 1.9.11 (CVE-2020-25074, CVE-2020-15275)
 * Sun Nov 25 2018 Athmane Madjoudj <athmane@fedoraproject.org> - 1.9.10-1
 - Update to 1.9.10 (rhbz #1641242)
 - Remove the backported patch
FEDORA-EPEL-2023-6569f44fa5 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2023-6569f44fa5

FEDORA-EPEL-2023-6569f44fa5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 testing repository.

If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.
